mutants.code:
def minimal_new_schools_needed(n, m, k, p, s, c):
    """
    Calculate the minimal number of new schools Arkady has to make up so that k Chosen Ones would be selected by the Technogoblet.

    Parameters:
    - n (int): Total number of students.
    - m (int): Number of schools.
    - k (int): Number of Chosen Ones.
    - p (list[int]): List of integers representing the power of each student.
    - s (list[int]): List of integers representing the school each student attends.
    - c (list[int]): List of integers representing the IDs of the Chosen Ones.

    Returns:
    - int: The minimal number of new schools to be made up by Arkady.
    """
    d = {}
    for i in range(n):
        if s[i] in d:
            d[s[i]] = (-1, -1)
        if p[i] > d[s[i]][0]:
            d[s[i]] = (p[i], i)
    st = set()
    for school in d:
        st.add(d[school][1] + 1)
    c = set(c)
    c = c.difference(st)
    return len(c)

def minimal_new_schools_needed(n, m, k, p, s, c):
    """
    Calculate the minimal number of new schools Arkady has to make up so that k Chosen Ones would be selected by the Technogoblet.

    Parameters:
    - n (int): Total number of students.
    - m (int): Number of schools.
    - k (int): Number of Chosen Ones.
    - p (list[int]): List of integers representing the power of each student.
    - s (list[int]): List of integers representing the school each student attends.
    - c (list[int]): List of integers representing the IDs of the Chosen Ones.

    Returns:
    - int: The minimal number of new schools to be made up by Arkady.
    """
    d = {}
    for i in range(n):
        if s[i] not in d:
            d[s[i]] = (-1, -1)
        if p[i] >= d[s[i]][0]:
            d[s[i]] = (p[i], i)
    st = set()
    for school in d:
        st.add(d[school][1] + 1)
    c = set(c)
    c = c.difference(st)
    return len(c)

def minimal_new_schools_needed(n, m, k, p, s, c):
    """
    Calculate the minimal number of new schools Arkady has to make up so that k Chosen Ones would be selected by the Technogoblet.

    Parameters:
    - n (int): Total number of students.
    - m (int): Number of schools.
    - k (int): Number of Chosen Ones.
    - p (list[int]): List of integers representing the power of each student.
    - s (list[int]): List of integers representing the school each student attends.
    - c (list[int]): List of integers representing the IDs of the Chosen Ones.

    Returns:
    - int: The minimal number of new schools to be made up by Arkady.
    """
    d = {}
    for i in range(n):
        if s[i] not in d:
            d[s[i]] = (-1, -1)
        if p[i] <= d[s[i]][0]:
            d[s[i]] = (p[i], i)
    st = set()
    for school in d:
        st.add(d[school][1] + 1)
    c = set(c)
    c = c.difference(st)
    return len(c)

def minimal_new_schools_needed(n, m, k, p, s, c):
    """
    Calculate the minimal number of new schools Arkady has to make up so that k Chosen Ones would be selected by the Technogoblet.

    Parameters:

    - s (list[int]): List of integers representing the school each student attends.
    - c (list[int]): List of integers representing the IDs of the Chosen Ones.

    Returns:
    - int: The minimal number of new schools to be made up by Arkady.
    """
    d = {}
    for i in range(n):
        if s[i] not in d:
            d[s[i]] = (-1, -1)
        if p[i] != d[s[i]][0]:
            d[s[i]] = (p[i], i)
    st = set()
    for school in d:
        st.add(d[school][1] + 1)
    c = set(c)
    c = c.difference(st)
    return len(c)

    - n (int): Total number of students.
    - m (int): Number of schools.
    - k (int): Number of Chosen Ones.
    - p (list[int]): List of integers representing the power of each student.
    - s (list[int]): List of integers representing the school each student attends.
    - c (list[int]): List of integers representing the IDs of the Chosen Ones.

    Returns:
    - int: The minimal number of new schools to be made up by Arkady.
    """
    d = {}
    for i in range(n):
        if s[i] not in d:
            d[s[i]] = (-1, -1)
        if p[i] > d[s[i]][0]:
            d[s[i]] = (p[i], i)
    st = set()
    for school in d:
        st.add(d[school][0] + 1)
    c = set(c)
    c = c.difference(st)
    return len(c)

def minimal_new_schools_needed(n, m, k, p, s, c):
    """
    Calculate the minimal number of new schools Arkady has to make up so that k Chosen Ones would be selected by the Technogoblet.

    Parameters:
    - n (int): Total number of students.
    - m (int): Number of schools.
    - k (int): Number of Chosen Ones.
    - p (list[int]): List of integers representing the power of each student.
    - s (list[int]): List of integers representing the school each student attends.
    - c (list[int]): List of integers representing the IDs of the Chosen Ones.

    Returns:
    - int: The minimal number of new schools to be made up by Arkady.
    """
    d = {}
    for i in range(n):
        if s[i] not in d:
            d[s[i]] = (-1, -1)
        if p[i] > d[s[i]][0]:
            d[s[i]] = (p[i], i)
    st = set()
    for school in d:
        st.add(d[school][0] + 1)
    c = set(c)
    c = c.difference(st)
    return len(c)

def minimal_new_schools_needed(n, m, k, p, s, c):
    """
    Calculate the minimal number of new schools Arkady has to make up so that k Chosen Ones would be selected by the Technogoblet.

    Parameters:
    - n (int): Total number of students.
    - m (int): Number of schools.
    - k (int): Number of Chosen Ones.
    - p (list[int]): List of integers representing the power of each student.
    - s (list[int]): List of integers representing the school each student attends.
    - c (list[int]): List of integers representing the IDs of the Chosen Ones.

    Returns:
    - int: The minimal number of new schools to be made up by Arkady.
    """
    d = {}
    for i in range(n):
        if s[i] not in d:
            d[s[i]] = (-1, -1)
        if p[i] > d[s[i]][0]:
            d[s[i]] = (p[i], i)
    st = set()
    for school in d:
        st.add(d[school][-1] + 1)
    c = set(c)
    c = c.difference(st)
    return len(c)
